channel.title: üè¢ University of Alberta on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Alberta on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A Method for Evaluating Hyperparameter Sensitivity in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: New empirical methodology quantifies how much reinforcement learning algorithm performance relies on per-environment hyperparameter tuning, enabling better algorithm design.

item.title: Almost Free: Self-concordance in Natural Exponential Families and an Application to Bandits
item.description: Generalized linear bandits with subexponential reward distributions are self-concordant, enabling second-order regret bounds free of exponential dependence on problem parameters.

item.title: Confident Natural Policy Gradient for Local Planning in q_œÄ-realizable Constrained MDPs
item.description: Confident-NPG-CMDP: First primal-dual algorithm achieving polynomial sample complexity for solving constrained Markov decision processes (CMDPs) using function approximation and local access model.

item.title: Deep Policy Gradient Methods Without Batch Updates, Target Networks, or Replay Buffers
item.description: Deep RL excels in simulated robotics, but struggles with real-world limitations like limited computational resources. This paper introduces Action Value Gradient (AVG), a novel incremental deep polic…

item.title: Distributional Reinforcement Learning with Regularized Wasserstein Loss
item.description: Sinkhorn distributional RL (SinkhornDRL) uses a regularized Wasserstein loss to improve distributional reinforcement learning.

item.title: Learning Truncated Causal History Model for Video Restoration
item.description: TURTLE: a novel video restoration framework that learns a truncated causal history model for efficient and high-performing video restoration, achieving state-of-the-art results on various benchmark ta…

item.title: Real-Time Recurrent Learning using Trace Units in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Recurrent Trace Units (RTUs) significantly enhance real-time recurrent learning in reinforcement learning, outperforming other methods with less computation.

item.title: Trajectory Data Suffices for Statistically Efficient Learning in Offline RL with Linear q^œÄ-Realizability and Concentrability
item.description: Offline RL with trajectory data achieves statistically efficient learning under linear q*-realizability and concentrability, solving a previously deemed impossible problem.

item.title: Unleashing Multispectral Video's Potential in Semantic Segmentation: A Semi-supervised Viewpoint and New UAV-View Benchmark
item.description: New MVUAV dataset and SemiMV semi-supervised learning model significantly improve multispectral video semantic segmentation!
